blocks.content:
**Availability**

Right now, I'm contracting at The Co-op, working on their [Legal Services](https://www.co-oplegalservices.co.uk/ "Co-op Legal Services") website. They've extended my contract until November 2020 so I won't be looking for a new role until September at the earliest.

**Clients**

The Co-op

Booking.com

Rentalcars

Betfred (via degree53)

The British Council

The National Audit Office

The University of Salford

Amaze PLC

**Key Achievements**

Diagnosed and fixed an issue for Booking.com that was costing £1.8MM/yr in unnecessary outbound calls.

Setup an abandoned cart email marketing system for an e-commerce client that has recovered over £1MM in lost revenue.

Eliminated a high volume of inbound telephone and email enquiries for Marriage Care by creating a book and pay system.

Setup version control and a continuous delivery on the Dyno Rod and the National Audit Office projects.

Created a system that allowed the rapid deployment 22 of country-level microsites for the British Council helping their Digital team to get their main project back on schedule.

Setup donations facility for local charity bringing in an extra £6K/yr in one-time donations and £12K/yr in regular donations.

Recovered multiple hacked websites with no loss of data, helping their owners to understand why they’d been hacked and how to avoid the same fate in the future.

Part of the team that built and deployed the Cars.booking.com white label for Rentalcars now generates approx 20% of all Rentalcars revenue.

Increased user engagement in Betfred’s mobile app by adding live stats to in-play events.

**What This Site Is For**

In addition to sharing some of my client work, I wanted to start publishing some of the tools I've built for myself over the past few years. I'll be adding them in the near future.

hero.headline: Hi there!
hero.textline: My name is John Peden and I'm a contract front-end web developer based in Manchester.
